member.name: T:DarkRift.Server.DependencyResolutionStrategy

member.name: F:DarkRift.Server.DependencyResolutionStrategy.Standard
member.summary: Uses the standard .NET assembly resolution with no enhancements.
member.remarks: This strategy will search for dependencies for using the standard .NET rules detailed here.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Server.DependencyResolutionStrategy.RecursiveFromFile
member.summary: Recursively searches all subdirectories of each file's containing folder in addition to the standard .NET assembly resolution.
member.remarks: This strategy will search for dependencies for using the standard .NET rules detailed here but with additional steps to search through each discovered file's containing folder and any subdirectory of it.

member.name: F:DarkRift.Server.DependencyResolutionStrategy.RecursiveFromDirectory
member.summary: Recursively searches all subdirectories of the folder's containing folder in addition to the standard .NET assembly resolution.
member.remarks: This strategy will search for dependencies for using the standard .NET rules detailed here but with additional steps to search through the specified directory and any subdirectory of it. This cannot be used when using a path to a file.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Server.ServerObjectCacheHelper.InitializeObjectCache(DarkRift.Server.ServerObjectCacheSettings)
member.summary: Initializes the object cache.
member.remarks:
Normally, initializing the object cache is handled for you when you create a server or client however there are times when it is necessary to initialize it without creating a server or client such as during testing. This method can be used to initialize the cache in those circumstances.
If the cache is already initialized this method will do nothing.
This method will also initialize the .

member.name: M:DarkRift.Server.ServerRegistryConnector.RegisterServer(System.String,System.String,System.UInt16,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Registers the server with the cluster registry.
member.remarks: This will be called when the server starts up and indicates that the server should be added to the registry to be discovered by other servers.
member.param: The group this server belongs to.
The advertised host of this server.
The advertised port of this server.
Any additional properties of this server.
member.returns: The ID of the server in the registry.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Server.ServerRegistryConnector.DeregisterServer
member.summary: Deregisters the server from the cluster registry.
member.remarks: This will be called when the server closes down and indicates that the server should be removed from the registry. This may not always be called depending on how the server closed and so health checks should be used or an implementation of supplied as a failsafe.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Server.ServerRegistryConnector.HandleConnectionFailure(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Called when DarkRift is unable to connect to a server that the registry supplied.
member.remarks:
This can be used as an alternative to health checks to search for entries in the registry that have become unresponsive.
This method will be called whenever a server is unable to be connected to after the configured number of retries. It will be called regardless of if this is the first time connecting following a call to or if it is a reconnection attempt following a lost connection.
By default this method does nothing.
member.param: The ID of the server unable to connect to.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Server.ServerRegistryConnector.HandleServerJoin(System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.UInt16,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Instructs the server that a new server has joined the cluster.
member.remarks:
Upon calling this method DarkRift will decide whether is it necessary to track this server and whether or not a connection needs to be made to it based on the contents of the system configuration file. Therefore it is ok to call this method for all servers regardless of whether the server's group is relevant to this server or not.
Similarly this method can be called on a server when that server is the server joining (i.e. notifying it of itself) and aditional checks do not need to be put in place in the connector as that call will be discarded automatically.
member.param: The ID of the server.
The group the server is part of.
The host of the server.
The port of the server.
The additional properties to connect with.

member.name: M:DarkRift.Server.ServerRegistryConnector.HandleServerLeave(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Instructs the server that a server has left the cluster.
member.remarks: Upon calling this method DarkRift will check to see if it is actually connected to the server before performing any action. Therefore it is ok to call this method for all servers regardless of whether the server's group is relevant to this server or not.
member.param: The ID of the server.
